intro: Euodia pedunculosa, commonly known as the mountain pepper tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a peppery flavor. Euodia pedunculosa is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and inland areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a subject of ecological study.
